paper_abstract: In our work the traditional bipartite model of ontologies is extended with the social dimension, leading to a tripartite model of actors, concepts and instances. We demonstrate the application of this representation by showing how community- based semantics emerges from this model through a process of graph transformation. We illustrate ontology emergence by two case studies, an analysis of a large scale folksonomy system and a novel method for the extraction of community- based ontologies from Web pages. (C) 2006 Elsevier B. V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Ontologies are us: A unified model of social networks and semantics
